items.text: Newtonian Gravitation | scientific | physics | 17th century | A classical theory describing gravity as an attractive force between masses, inversely proportional to the square of the distance. | Key concepts: inverse-square law, force, mass | Status: superseded in extremes by General Relativity; still useful at low speeds/weak fields | Tags: mechanics, classical physics | Sources: Principia Mathematica (1687)

meta.name: Newtonian Gravitation
meta.summary: A classical theory describing gravity as an attractive force between masses, inversely proportional to the square of the distance.
meta.status: superseded in extremes by General Relativity; still useful at low speeds/weak fields

items.text: General Relativity | scientific | physics | 20th century | Einstein's geometric theory of gravitation where mass-energy curves spacetime and free-falling objects follow geodesics. | Key concepts: spacetime curvature, geodesics, equivalence principle | Status: well-tested; breaks down near singularities / not unified with quantum mechanics | Tags: gravity, relativity | Sources: Einstein (1915), Eddington eclipse 1919, LIGO

meta.name: General Relativity
meta.summary: Einstein's geometric theory of gravitation where mass-energy curves spacetime and free-falling objects follow geodesics.
meta.status: well-tested; breaks down near singularities / not unified with quantum mechanics

items.text: String Theory | scientific | theoretical physics | late 20th century | Proposes that fundamental particles are one-dimensional strings; aims to unify quantum mechanics and gravity. | Key concepts: strings, branes, extra dimensions | Status: unconfirmed; mathematically rich | Tags: unification, quantum gravity | Sources: Polchinski, Witten

meta.name: String Theory
meta.summary: Proposes that fundamental particles are one-dimensional strings; aims to unify quantum mechanics and gravity.

items.text: Miasma Theory of Disease | historical | medicine | antiquity19th century | Disease was thought to be caused by 'bad air' (miasma). Replaced by germ theory. | Key concepts: bad air, odor, sanitation | Status: discredited | Tags: history of medicine | Sources: Nightingale, Chadwick

meta.name: Miasma Theory of Disease
meta.summary: Disease was thought to be caused by 'bad air' (miasma). Replaced by germ theory.

items.text: Germ Theory of Disease | scientific | biology/medicine | 19th century | Microorganisms are the cause of many diseases; led to antisepsis, vaccination, and antibiotics. | Key concepts: pathogens, infection, Koch's postulates | Status: established | Tags: microbiology, public health | Sources: Pasteur, Koch

meta.name: Germ Theory of Disease
meta.summary: Microorganisms are the cause of many diseases; led to antisepsis, vaccination, and antibiotics.

items.text: Simulation Hypothesis | philosophical | philosophy of mind/metaphysics | 21st century prominence | The idea that reality could be an artificial simulation (e.g., computer simulation). | Key concepts: posthuman, substrate-independence, indistinguishability | Status: speculative | Tags: metaphysics, ai | Sources: Bostrom (2003)

meta.name: Simulation Hypothesis
meta.summary: The idea that reality could be an artificial simulation (e.g., computer simulation).

items.text: Hogwarts Magic Theory | imaginary | fantasy | fictional / contemporary | Within the Harry Potter universe, magic is a manipulable force governed by wands, incantations, and intent. | Key concepts: spells, wands, incantations | Status: fictional | Tags: fantasy, worldbuilding | Sources: Rowling's works

meta.name: Hogwarts Magic Theory
meta.summary: Within the Harry Potter universe, magic is a manipulable force governed by wands, incantations, and intent.

items.text: Flat Earth Theory | pseudoscientific | cosmology | ancient origins / modern revival | Claims Earth is flat; conflicts with observational evidence (satellites, circumnavigation, photos, physics). | Key concepts: horizon misinterpretation, conspiracy | Status: discredited | Tags: debunked, critical thinking | Sources: astronomy, spaceflight data

meta.name: Flat Earth Theory
meta.summary: Claims Earth is flat; conflicts with observational evidence (satellites, circumnavigation, photos, physics).
